Source code for JumpScale.core.pmtypes.PrimitiveTypes

'''Definition of several primitive type properties (integer, string,...)'''

from JumpScale.core.pmtypes.base import BaseType

class Boolean(BaseType):
    '''Generic boolean type'''

[docs]    NAME = 'boolean'

    @staticmethod
    def fromString(s):
        if s.upper() in ('0', 'FALSE'):

[docs]            return False
        elif s.upper() in ('1', 'TRUE'):
            return True
        else:
            raise ValueError("Invalid value for boolean: '%s'" % s)

    @staticmethod
    def checkString(s):

        try:

[docs]            Boolean.fromString(s)
            return True
        except ValueError:
            return False

    @staticmethod
    def toString(boolean):

        return str(boolean)

[docs]
    @staticmethod
    def check(value):

        '''Check whether provided value is a boolean'''

[docs]        return value is True or value is False

class Integer(BaseType):
    '''Generic integer type'''


[docs]    NAME = 'integer'


    @staticmethod
    def checkString(s):
        return s.isdigit()

[docs]
    @staticmethod
    def check(value):

        '''Check whether provided value is an integer'''

[docs]        return isinstance(value, (int, long, ))

class String(BaseType):
    '''Generic string type'''


[docs]    NAME = 'string'

    @staticmethod
    def fromString(s):
        return s

[docs]
    @staticmethod
    def toString(v):

        return v

[docs]
